meanings.definition: To engage in an apprenticeship or training program.
meanings.sent1: She is prenticing at the bakery to become a skilled baker.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys prenticing under the watchful eye of the experienced carpenter.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried prenticing with the dog on how to catch mice, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was prenticing with new ideas, ready to be molded and shaped.
meanings.sent5: The young artist was prenticing diligently, honing her craft day by day.

meanings.definition: The act of learning a trade or skill through practical experience.
meanings.sent1: His prenticing in woodworking began at a young age in his grandfather's workshop.
meanings.sent2: The best way to learn is through prenticing and hands-on practice.
meanings.sent3: The robot's prenticing in human emotions led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The prenticing of the sun as it sets paints the sky in a beautiful array of colors.
meanings.sent5: The prenticing of a seed growing into a plant is a fascinating process to observe.

meanings.definition: The process of being trained or guided by a skilled mentor.
meanings.sent1: She found great value in the prenticing she received from her wise mentor.
meanings.sent2: Prenticing with a master craftsman is a privilege not to be taken lightly.
meanings.sent3: The prenticing of the squirrel by the wise old owl was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The prenticing of the river by the mountains shapes the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: The prenticing of a young mind by a caring teacher can have a lasting impact.
